edu.stanford.math.plex4.streams.impl
Class VietorisRipsStream<T>

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.math.plex4.streams.interfaces.PrimitiveStream<Simplex>
      edu.stanford.math.plex4.streams.impl.ConditionalFlagComplexStream
          edu.stanford.math.plex4.streams.impl.FlagComplexStream
              edu.stanford.math.plex4.streams.impl.VietorisRipsStream<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the base type of the underlying metric space
All Implemented Interfaces:
AbstractFilteredStream<Simplex>, java.lang.Iterable<Simplex>
public class VietorisRipsStream<T>
extends FlagComplexStream

This class implements the Vietoris-Rips filtered simplicial complex. A simplex [v_0, ..., v_k] is in VR(r) if and only if the pairwise distances d(v_i, v_j) are less than r for all 0 <= i, j <= k. Thus a Vietoris-Rips complex is fully defined by its 1-skeleton, in that it is the maximal simplicial complex given such a 1-skeleton. For this reason, we simply derive from the FlagComplexStream abstract class, and implement the pairwise thresholding in order to generate the 1-skeleton.

Author:
Andrew Tausz

Method Detail

constructEdges

protected UndirectedWeightedListGraph constructEdges()
Description copied from class: ConditionalFlagComplexStream
This function implements the construction of the 1-skeleton. It must output a list containing pairs of filtration values and 1-simplices. The filtration value of an edge is the threshold value at which the edge appears in the filtered sequence of simplicial complexes.

Specified by:
constructEdges in class ConditionalFlagComplexStream
Returns:
the 1-skeleton of the complex along with its filtration values
